<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 11pt; margin-top: 11pt"><!-- Change: 11111 to jobnumber --><DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><A Href="g17619e10vk.htm">Aflac
Incorporated 2008 Form 10-K</A></DIV>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT 10.21</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>THIRD AMENDMENT<BR>
TO THE<BR>
AFLAC INCORPORATED 2004 LONG-TERM INCENTIVE PLAN</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>THIS THIRD AMENDMENT </B>to the AFLAC Incorporated 2004 Long-Term Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) is
made on this 19th day of December, 2008, by Aflac Incorporated (the &#147;Company&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>W I T
N E S S E T H :</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>WHEREAS</B>, the Company maintains the Plan to provide long-term incentives to its eligible
officers and other employees, and to its nonemployee directors and consultants; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>WHEREAS</B>, Section&nbsp;19 of the Plan authorizes the Board of Directors of the Company to amend the
Plan; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>WHEREAS</B>, the Company desires to amend the Plan to comply with the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A
of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and all applicable regulations and guidance
issued thereunder (&#147;Section&nbsp;409A&#148;); and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>WHEREAS</B>, this Third Amendment is intended to comply with the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A and
is to be construed in accordance with the terms of Section&nbsp;409A;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>NOW, THEREFORE</B>, the Plan is hereby amended as follows, effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2009:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The definition of &#147;Change in Control&#148; in Section&nbsp;2 shall be amended by adding the following
at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this definition, &#147;Change in Control&#148;
with respect to any Award shall mean a Change in Control as defined in the
Agreement relating to such Award if different from the foregoing.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The definition of &#147;Disability&#148; in Section&nbsp;2 shall be amended to read as follows:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Disability&#148; shall mean (i)&nbsp;any physical or mental condition that would qualify a
Participant for a disability benefit under any long-term disability plan maintained
by the Company (or by any Affiliate by which he is employed); or (ii)&nbsp;when used in
connection with the exercise of an Incentive Stock Option following termination of
employment, disability within the meaning of Section&nbsp;22(e)(3) of the Code.
Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this definition, &#147;Disability&#148; with
respect to any Award shall mean a Disability as defined in the Agreement relating
to such Award if different from the foregoing.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">3.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The definition of &#147;Fair Market Value&#148; in Section&nbsp;2 shall be amended by adding the following
at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this definition, to the extent
necessary to comply with Section&nbsp;409A in order to avoid the imposition of penalties
or interest in respect thereof, Fair Market Value shall be determined in a manner
consistent with Section&nbsp;409A.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">4.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;2 shall be amended to add the following definitions thereto:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Section&nbsp;409A&#148; shall mean Section&nbsp;409A of the Code and all applicable regulations
and guidance issued thereunder.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Separation from Service&#148; or &#147;Separate from Service&#148; shall mean a separation from
service as defined in Section&nbsp;409A.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">5.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;3(c) shall be amended by adding the following at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing, any actions taken under this Section 3(c) shall be
made in a manner consistent with Section&nbsp;409A, including without limitation any
restrictions with regard to the adjustment of stock options and stock appreciation
rights that are considered exempt from Section&nbsp;409A.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">6.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;3(d) shall be amended by adding the following at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing, any actions taken under this Section 3(d) shall be
made in a manner consistent with Section&nbsp;409A, including without limitation any
restrictions with regard to the adjustment of stock options and stock appreciation
rights that are considered exempt from Section&nbsp;409A.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;4(b) shall be amended by adding the following at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing, any actions taken under this Section 4(b) shall be
made in a manner consistent with Section&nbsp;409A, including without limitation any
restrictions with regard to the adjustment of stock options and stock appreciation
rights that are considered exempt from Section&nbsp;409A.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">8.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;7(a) shall be amended by adding the following at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Nonqualified Stock Options and Stock Appreciation Rights may be granted only with
respect to &#147;service recipient stock&#148; as such term is used in Section&nbsp;409A.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">9.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;8(e) shall be amended to read as follows:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>(e) <I>Dividends on Restricted Stock</I>. Dividends on Restricted Stock shall be payable
at the time and pursuant to the payment schedule specified by the Committee at the
time of grant in the Agreement relating to such Award, subject to the requirements
of Section&nbsp;409A to the extent applicable, or, if the Committee does not provide a
time and schedule of payment at the time of grant, any dividends shall be payable
in a lump sum on the date the dividend on Company Stock is payable to shareholders
generally.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">10.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;9(b) shall be amended to read as follows:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>(b) <I>Issuance of Shares</I>. No shares of Company Stock (or other property) shall be
issued at the time Restricted Stock Units are granted. Upon the lapse or waiver of
restrictions and the restricted period relating to Restricted Stock Units and no
later than 30&nbsp;days thereafter (or at such later time as may be determined by the
Committee and specified at the time of grant in the Agreement relating to such
Award, in accordance with the requirements of Section</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>409A to the extent applicable), shares of Company Stock shall be issued to the
holder of the Restricted Stock Units and evidenced in such manner as the Committee
may deem appropriate, including book-entry registration or issuance of one or more
stock certificates.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">11.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;11(b) shall be amended by deleting therein the words &#147;or the Committee in its sole
discretion determines otherwise.&#148;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">12.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;19 shall be amended by adding the following at the end thereof:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Section&nbsp;19, no amendment,
alteration, suspension, discontinuance or termination may be made that would cause
a Participant to become subject to tax under Section&nbsp;409A(a)(1).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">13.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Section&nbsp;31 shall be amended to read as follows:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>31. Interpretation</U>. The Plan is designed and intended to comply with Rule
16b-3 and, to the extent applicable, with Section 162(m) and Section&nbsp;409A of the
Code, and all provisions hereof shall be construed in a manner to so comply.
Headings to Sections of the Plan are intended for convenience of reference only and
shall have no affect on the interpretation of the Plan.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">14.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A new Section&nbsp;33 shall be added to the Plan to read as follows:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>33. Code Section&nbsp;409A</U>. It is the intent of the Company that the Plan shall
be administered in accordance with Section&nbsp;409A, to the extent applicable, and
shall not cause the acceleration of (or the imposition of additional) taxes
provided for in Section&nbsp;409A. Awards and other grants or payments under the Plan
shall be made, paid out and/or modified in a manner intended to avoid resulting in
the acceleration of taxation (or the imposition of penalty taxation) under Section
409A upon a Participant. Notwithstanding anything in the Plan to the contrary,
with respect to any Awards or other grants or payments that provide nonqualified
deferred compensation subject to Section&nbsp;409A, no payment to a &#147;specified employee&#148;
(as such term is defined in Section&nbsp;409A) upon Separation from Service, to the
extent required under Section&nbsp;409A, shall be made before six (6)&nbsp;months after the
date on which the Separation from Service occurs. All distributions under the Plan
shall be made in the form of a single sum, unless otherwise specified under the
terms of the Plan or by the Committee at the time of grant.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B>, the Company has caused its duly authorized officer to execute this Third
Amendment on the date first written above.
</DIV>

<HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-10.32</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 11pt; margin-top: 11pt"><!-- Change: 11111 to jobnumber --><DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><A Href="g17619e10vk.htm">Aflac
Incorporated 2008 Form 10-K</A></DIV>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT 10.32</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">AMENDMENT TO EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT<BR>
BETWEEN DANIEL P. AMOS AND<BR>
AFLAC INCORPORATED
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS
AMENDMENT (&#147;Amendment&#148;) is entered into as of the 8th day of December, 2008, by
and between Aflac Incorporated, a Georgia corporation (hereinafter referred to as &#147;Corporation&#148;)
and Daniel P. Amos (hereinafter referred to as &#147;Employee&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">W I T N
E S S E T H:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Corporation and Employee entered into an Employment Agreement dated August&nbsp;1, 1993,
and subsequently agreed to modify said agreement by various amendments (as so amended, the
&#147;Employment Agreement&#148;);
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (&#147;Section&nbsp;409A&#148;), is
applicable to certain provisions of the Employment Agreement; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Corporation and Employee desire to modify the Employment Agreement, effective as of
January&nbsp;1, 2009, in order to comply with Section&nbsp;409A;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants set forth and contained
herein, Corporation and Employee agree that the Employment Agreement shall be modified as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Paragraph&nbsp;7 shall be amended by adding at the end thereof the following:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Amounts payable to Employee under the Management Incentive Plan (or any
successor or other executive bonus program) shall be payable in such manner,
at such times and in such forms, as prescribed by the terms of the
Management Incentive Plan (or successor or other program).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Paragraph&nbsp;8 shall be amended by adding at the end thereof the following:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any reimbursements made pursuant to the preceding sentence shall be paid as
soon as practicable but no later than 90&nbsp;days after Employee submits
evidence of such expenses to Corporation (which payment date shall in no
event be later than the last day of the calendar year following the calendar
year in which the expense was incurred). The amount of such reimbursements
during any calendar year shall not affect the benefits provided in any other
calendar year, and the right to any such benefits shall not be subject to
liquidation or exchange for another benefit.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --> Page 1 of 6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;11 shall be amended by adding a new (unnumbered)&nbsp;paragraph at the end thereof to
read as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any expense reimbursements made to satisfy the terms of this Paragraph
11 shall be paid as soon as practicable but no later than 90&nbsp;days after
Employee submits evidence of such expenses to Corporation (which payment
date shall in no event be later than the last day of the calendar year
following the calendar year in which the expense was incurred). The amount
of such reimbursements during any calendar year shall not affect the
benefits provided in any other calendar year, and the right to any benefits
under this paragraph shall not be subject to liquidation or exchange for
another benefit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13 shall be amended by adding at the end of the fourth paragraph thereof a new
provision as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">; provided, these provisions shall not affect the timing or form of his
distributions under said plan, which shall be determined solely under the
terms of said plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;14 shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and replacing it
with the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.&nbsp;<U>TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A. <U>TERMINATION BY CORPORATION</U>. Corporation may, when acting in
accordance with resolutions adopted by a two-third&#146;s (2/3) majority vote of its
entire Board acting at a meeting called for the purpose of considering Employee&#146;s
termination, terminate this Agreement, at any time, with or without &#147;good cause&#148;
(&#147;good cause&#148; being hereinafter defined), by giving at least sixty (60)&nbsp;days&#146;
written notice to Employee of its intention to terminate Employee&#146;s employment
without &#147;good cause&#148; or at least five (5)&nbsp;days&#146; written notice to Employee of its
intention to terminate Employee&#146;s employment for &#147;good cause&#148;; provided, however,
Corporation may, at its election, terminate Employee&#146;s actual employment (so that
Employee no longer renders services on behalf of Corporation) at any time during
said sixty (60)&nbsp;day or five (5)&nbsp;day period.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;B. <U>TERMINATION BY EMPLOYEE</U>. Employee may terminate this Agreement, at
any time either for good reason (being hereafter defined) or without good reason, by
giving at least sixty (60)&nbsp;days&#146; written notice to Corporation of his intention to
terminate his employment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;C. <U>PAY AND BENEFITS</U>. In the event of any termination of Employee&#146;s
employment hereunder, Corporation shall be obligated to:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) pay Employee his base salary (as provided for in Paragraph&nbsp;5 of this
Agreement) earned through the last day of his actual employment;
</DIV>

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --> Page 2 of 6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) pay Employee his performance bonus compensation (as provided for in
Paragraph&nbsp;7 of this Agreement) that has accrued and vested but not been paid as of
the last day of his actual employment;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) continue to honor all stock options, subject to the terms thereof, granted
to Employee prior to the termination date stated in said written notice; provided,
in the event Employee&#146;s termination is (i)&nbsp;by Corporation without good cause (and
not by Corporation for good cause), or (ii)&nbsp;by Employee for good reason (but not by
Employee without good reason) and not by Employee with the intention to enter a
business competitive with that of the Corporation, all of said options not already
vested shall become fully vested as of the last day of his employment;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) continue to pay or provide to Employee all of the retirement, health, life
and disability benefits, as are provided for in this Agreement or under any
programs, plans or policies covering Employee at the time of any notice of
termination, through the last day of his actual employment; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e) pay Employee and/or his wife such benefits as provided for in the
Retirement Plan for Senior Officers (see Paragraph&nbsp;9 above), in a manner and in such
forms and at such times, as provided under the terms of said plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D. <U>GOOD CAUSE</U>. For purposes of this Paragraph&nbsp;14, &#147;good cause&#148; shall
mean: (i)&nbsp;the willful and deliberate failure by Employee to substantially perform
his executive and management duties hereunder for a continuous period of more than
sixty (60)&nbsp;days for reasons other than Employee&#146;s sickness, injury or disability;
(ii)&nbsp;the willful and deliberate conduct by Employee which is intended by Employee to
cause, and which does in fact result in substantial injury or damage to Corporation;
or (iii)&nbsp;the conviction or plea of guilty by Employee of a felony crime involving
moral turpitude. Prior to the Corporation&#146;s decision to terminate Employee&#146;s
employment for &#147;good cause&#148; as hereinabove provided, the Board shall give written
notice to Employee setting forth the specific charges against Employee being
considered by the Board to constitute &#147;good cause&#148; as defined in this subparagraph
and the Board shall, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after such notice, give Employee an
opportunity to fully respond and defend himself against such charges before the
Board. Within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days after the last day on which Employee is given the
opportunity to defend himself before the Board, the Board, acting in good faith,
shall make its determination as to whether or not the charges against Employee
constitute &#147;good cause&#148; and shall notify Employee in writing of its determination
together with a full explanation of the basis thereof.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E. <U>GOOD REASON</U>. For purposes of this Paragraph&nbsp;14, &#147;good reason&#148; shall
mean the termination of employment by Employee upon the occurrence of any one or
more of the following events:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) Any breach by Corporation of the terms and conditions of this Agreement
affecting Employee&#146;s salary and bonus compensation, any employee benefit, stock
options or the loss of any of Employee&#146;s titles or positions with Corporation;
</DIV>

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --> Page 3 of 6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) A significant diminution of Employee&#146;s duties and responsibilities;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c) The assignment to Employee of any duties inconsistent with or significantly
different from his duties and responsibilities existing at the time of such
assignment;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) Any purported termination of Employee&#146;s employment by Corporation other
than as permitted by this Agreement;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(e) The relocation of Corporation&#146;s principal office or of Employee&#146;s own
office to any place beyond twenty- five (25)&nbsp;miles from the current principal office
of Corporation in Columbus, Georgia; or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(f) The failure of any successor to Corporation to expressly assume and agree
to discharge Corporation&#146;s obligations to Employee under this Agreement, in form and
substance satisfactory to Employee.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F. <U>TERMINATION WHILE DISABLED</U>. If Employee is totally disabled at the
time any such notice of termination is given, then, notwithstanding the provisions
of this Paragraph&nbsp;14, Corporation shall nevertheless continue to pay Employee, as
his sole compensation hereunder, the compensation and other benefits for the
remaining period of Employee&#146;s total disability as provided for in Paragraph&nbsp;13
hereinabove. It is understood that in no event shall such disabled Employee be
entitled to compensation under this Paragraph&nbsp;14 in addition to the continuation of
his compensation under Paragraph&nbsp;13.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;15 shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and replacing it
with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15. <U>COOPERATION AFTER NOTICE OF TERMINATION</U>. Following any such notice
of termination, Employee shall fully cooperate with Corporation in all matters
relating to the winding up of his pending work on behalf of Corporation and the
orderly transfer of any such pending work to other employees of Corporation as may
be designated by the Board; and to that end, Corporation shall be entitled to
full-time services of Employee through his actual termination date and such
full-time or part-time services of Employee as Corporation may reasonably require
during all or any part of the sixty (60)-day period that both follows any such
notice of termination and his actual termination date; provided, the parties
acknowledge that, depending on the level of services so required, the provision of
such services may delay the timing of Employee&#146;s separation from service.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;16 shall be amended by adding to the end thereof the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">; provided, these provisions shall not affect the timing or form of his
distributions from such Plan, which shall be determined solely under the
terms of such Plan.
</DIV>

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --> Page 4 of 6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;17 shall be amended by (i)&nbsp;changing the reference to &#147;paragraph 19&#148; therein to
&#147;Paragraph&nbsp;14.E&#148;, and (ii)&nbsp;by changing the reference to &#147;Paragraph&nbsp;14&#148; therein to &#147;Paragraph&nbsp;14.D&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;20 shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and replacing it
with the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">&#091;PARAGRAPH RESERVED&#093;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;24 shall be amended by deleting therefrom the introductory phrase that reads as
follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except for any dispute or matter arising after a Change in Control as defined
in Paragraph&nbsp;19,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and by capitalizing the next following word, &#147;Any&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;A new Paragraph&nbsp;28 shall be added after Paragraph&nbsp;27 as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;28. <U>CODE SECTION 409A</U>. This Agreement, as amended by the Amendment
effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2009, is intended to comply with the requirements of Code
Section&nbsp;409A and shall be construed accordingly. Any payments or distributions to
be made to Employee under this Agreement upon a &#147;separation from service&#148; (as
defined in Code Section&nbsp;409A) of amounts classified as &#147;nonqualified deferred
compensation&#148; for purposes of Code Section&nbsp;409A, payable due to a separation from
service and not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, shall in no event be made or commence
until six (6)&nbsp;months after such separation from service. Each payment of
nonqualified deferred compensation under this Agreement shall be treated as a
separate payment for purposes of Code Section&nbsp;409A.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;Except as expressly amended by this Amendment, the Agreement shall remain in full force
and effect in accordance with its terms and continue to bind the parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.&nbsp;This Amendment shall be effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2009.
</DIV>

<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio --> Page 5 of 6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Corporation has hereunto caused its duly authorized executive to execute
this Amendment on behalf of Corporation, and Employee has hereunto set his hand and seal, all being
done in duplicate originals, with one original being delivered to each party, as of the 8
day of December, 2008.
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.34
<SEQUENCE>9
<FILENAME>g17619exv10w34.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.34
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-10.34</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 11pt; margin-top: 11pt"><!-- Change: 11111 to jobnumber --><DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><A Href="g17619e10vk.htm">Aflac
Incorporated 2008 Form 10-K</A></DIV>
</DIV>


 <DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT&nbsp;10.34</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt"><B>AMENDMENT TO EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT<BR>
BETWEEN KRISS CLONINGER, III AND<BR>
AFLAC INCORPORATED</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT (&#147;Amendment&#148;) is entered into as of the 31<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">st</SUP> day of October, 2008,
by and between Aflac Incorporated, a Georgia corporation (hereinafter referred to as &#147;Corporation&#148;)
and Kriss Cloninger, III (hereinafter referred to as &#147;Employee&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">W I T N
E S S E T H:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Corporation and Employee entered into an Employment Agreement dated February&nbsp;14,
1992, that was subsequently amended several times by the parties (as so amended, the &#147;Employment
Agreement&#148;);
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, the parties executed a previous amendment dated November&nbsp;12, 1993 which contained a
scrivener&#146;s error that did not accurately memorialize the true intent of the parties; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Corporation and Employee desire to modify the Employment Agreement, to accurately
state the true intent of the parties;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants set forth and contained
herein, Corporation and Employee agree that the Employment Agreement shall be modified as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;1 of the November&nbsp;12, 1993 Amendment to Employment Agreement is struck in its
entirety and Paragraph&nbsp;4 of the Employment Agreement shall be amended by deleting the second
sentence thereof and replacing it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&#147;On an annual basis beginning effective March&nbsp;16, 1993, the scheduled
term of this Agreement shall be extended for successive one (1)&nbsp;year
periods unless written notice of termination is given prior to such
annual date by one party to the other party that the Agreement will not
be extended by its terms.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Except as expressly amended by this Amendment, the Agreement shall remain in full force and
effect in accordance with its terms and continue to bind the parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;This Amendment shall be effective as the date set forth above.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, Corporation has hereunto caused its duly authorized executive to execute
this Amendment on behalf of Corporation, and Employee has hereunto set his hand and seal, all being
done in duplicate originals, with one original being delivered to each party, as of the
3rd day of November, 2008.
</DIV>

<TYPE>EX-10.35
<SEQUENCE>10

<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.35

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-10.35</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 11pt; margin-top: 11pt"><!-- Change: 11111 to jobnumber --><DIV align="justify" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><A Href="g17619e10vk.htm">Aflac
Incorporated 2008 Form 10-K</A></DIV>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT 10.35</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">AMENDMENT TO EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT<BR>
BETWEEN KRISS CLONINGER, III AND<BR>
AFLAC INCORPORATED
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS
AMENDMENT (&#147;Amendment&#148;) is entered into as of the 19th day of December, 2008, by
and between Aflac Incorporated, a Georgia corporation (hereinafter referred to as &#147;Corporation&#148;)
and Kriss Cloninger, III (hereinafter referred to as &#147;Employee&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 10pt">W I T N
E S S E T H:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Corporation and Employee entered into an Employment Agreement dated February&nbsp;14,
1992, that was subsequently amended several times by the parties (as so amended, the &#147;Employment
Agreement&#148;);
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (&#147;Section&nbsp;409A&#148;), is
applicable to certain provisions of the Employment Agreement; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Corporation and Employee desire to modify the Employment Agreement, effective as of
January&nbsp;1, 2009, in order to comply with Section&nbsp;409A;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants set forth and contained
herein, Corporation and Employee agree that the Employment Agreement shall be modified as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;7 shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and replacing it
with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%"><B>MANAGEMENT INCENTIVE PLAN</B>. In addition to the base salary paid to Employee in
accordance with Paragraph&nbsp;5, Corporation shall for each calendar year of
Employee&#146;s employment by Corporation, beginning with the calendar year 1999,
continue to pay Employee, as performance bonus compensation, an amount
determined each year under Corporation&#146;s current Management Incentive Plan
(short-term Incentive Program) with a target level based on at least 150% of
base salary. However, Employee&#146;s bonus shall not exceed 300% of base salary.
Amounts payable to Employee under the Management Incentive Plan (or any
successor executive bonus program) shall be payable in such manner, at such
times and in such forms, as prescribed by the terms of the Management Incentive
Plan (or successor program).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;8 shall be amended by deleting the last two sentences thereof and replacing them
with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Any reimbursements made pursuant to the preceding sentence shall be paid as
soon as practicable but no later than 90&nbsp;days after Employee submits evidence
of such expenses to Corporation (which payment date shall in no event be later
than the last day of the calendar year following the calendar year in which the
expense was incurred). The amount of such reimbursements during any calendar
year shall not affect the benefits provided in any other calendar year, and the
right to any such benefits shall not be subject
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Page 1 of 12
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">to liquidation or exchange for another benefit. If at the time of Employee&#146;s
death or, if earlier, his attainment of Medicare eligible age, either while
employed by Corporation or covered under Corporation&#146;s post-employment group
health plan, Employee has a spouse or dependent children who are covered
participants in Corporation&#146;s group health plan, those participants will be
permitted to continue their health insurance coverage through Corporation until
their eligibility would have expired had Employee remained active with
Corporation; provided, however, that Employee&#146;s spouse&#146;s benefits shall expire
in the event of said spouse&#146;s remarriage. This coverage will be provided on
the same basis as if the participants had continued to be members of that plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;10 shall be amended by adding a new (unnumbered)&nbsp;paragraph at the end thereof to
read as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">Any expense reimbursements made to satisfy the terms of this Paragraph&nbsp;10 shall
be paid as soon as practicable but no later than 90&nbsp;days after Employee submits
evidence of such expenses to Corporation (which payment date shall in no event
be later than the last day of the calendar year following the calendar year in
which the expense was incurred). The amount of such reimbursements during any
calendar year shall not affect the benefits provided in any other calendar
year, and the right to any benefits under this paragraph shall not be subject
to liquidation or exchange for another benefit.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;12 shall be amended by deleting the fourth paragraph thereof and replacing it
with a new fourth paragraph to read as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If, following Employee&#146;s becoming totally disabled, this Agreement shall
be terminated (as provided in the preceding paragraph) and Employee&#146;s
employment with Corporation terminated, Employee shall be 100% vested in, and
entitled to, benefits under the Aflac Incorporated Supplemental Executive
Retirement Plan (the &#147;SERP&#148;) determined as if Employee&#146;s &#147;Years of
Participation&#148; and &#147;Years of Employment&#148; (as such terms (or similar terms) are
defined in the SERP) include the period of time before such termination date
during which Employee was totally disabled. Furthermore, if on such
termination date Employee is not yet eligible for an early retirement benefit
under the SERP, Employee will be entitled to benefits under the SERP the amount
of which shall be determined as if his termination date was Employee&#146;s Early
Retirement Date (as such term is defined in the SERP); provided, these
provisions shall not affect the timing or form of his SERP distributions, which
shall be determined solely under the terms of the SERP.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.A(1)(a) shall be amended by:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Adding at the beginning thereof the following:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>upon Employee&#146;s separation from service (as defined in Paragraph&nbsp;13.E below),
</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Adding at the end thereof the following:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>provided further, such amount (if any) payable for the period after the
date of Employee&#146;s actual termination of employment (his &#147;Actual
Termination Date&#148;) will be paid in a timely manner in accordance with
Corporation&#146;s normal payroll practices; and provided further, to the
extent any amount payable for the period after his Actual Termination
Date is not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, such amount</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Page 2 of 12
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>will be paid in a single lump sum upon the day after the six (6)-month
anniversary of his separation from service;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.A(1)(b) shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and
replacing it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) pay Employee an amount equal to any performance bonus due Employee
under Paragraph&nbsp;7 of this Agreement for the period ending on the termination
date stated in said written notice or on such earlier date of Employee&#146;s actual
termination of his employment prior to the end of said five (5)-day period if
such termination is without the approval of Corporation (the earlier of such
dates being referred to as the &#147;Applicable Date&#148;). The amount of said bonus,
if any, will be calculated on a prorated basis, using the number of days during
the calendar year up to the Applicable Date, and will be paid to Employee
pursuant to the terms and customary operations of the Management Incentive
Program (or other applicable bonus program) except that Employee&#146;s performance
will be deemed to have achieved target while the actual performance of
Corporation will be applied to the performance goals under the plan; provided,
if the Applicable Date occurs after the end of the calendar year in which the
notice of termination is given, (i)&nbsp;the bonus payment for the calendar year in
which such notice is given will be paid without any proration, and (ii)&nbsp;the
proration described herein will apply to the next calendar year (<I>i.e., </I>the
calendar year in which the Applicable Date occurs), and the bonus for such next
calendar year will be paid upon Employee&#146;s separation from service in a lump
sum between January 1 and March&nbsp;15, inclusive, of the calendar year following
the calendar year in which the Applicable Date occurs or, if later and the
payment is not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, upon the day after the six (6)-month
anniversary of Employee&#146;s separation from service;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.A(1)(d) shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and
replacing it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) upon Employee&#146;s separation from service, continue to pay all of
Employee&#146;s fringe and other employee benefits as provided for in this Agreement
up to the Applicable Date. Notwithstanding the foregoing, even if Corporation
approves Employee&#146;s cessation of rendering full-time services on behalf of
Corporation prior to the termination date stated in the written notice of
termination from Corporation, after Employee&#146;s Actual Termination Date,
Employee shall not actively participate in any retirement plan qualified under
Code Section&nbsp;401(a), any employee stock purchase plan under Code Section&nbsp;423,
any fully insured benefit for which the insurer does not allow post-employment
participation, or any other plan or benefit (other than Corporation&#146;s
self-insured group health plan) that Corporation or the third-party insurer of
such benefit reasonably determines is not suitable or available for
post-employment participation. In such event, Employee shall be entitled to the
benefits described in clauses (i)&nbsp;and (ii)&nbsp;of Paragraph&nbsp;13.A(2)(d) below, to
the extent applicable, but only up to the Applicable Date;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;Paragraphs 13.A(2)(a) and (b)&nbsp;shall be amended by deleting said paragraphs in their
entirety and replacing them with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) upon Employee&#146;s separation from service, pay Employee his base salary
as provided for in Paragraph&nbsp;5 of this Agreement up to the end of the scheduled
term of this Agreement; provided, such amount payable for the period after his
Actual Termination Date will be paid in accordance with the regular payroll
schedule applicable
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Page 3 of 12
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">to all other similarly-situated active executive employees of Corporation
commencing with the next regularly scheduled payday, with any portion of such
amount that is not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A and that is otherwise payable
within the six (6)-month period beginning on the date of his separation from
service being paid in a lump sum upon the day after the six (6)-month
anniversary of his separation from service;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) pay Employee an amount equal to a portion of his performance bonus
compensation as provided for in Paragraph&nbsp;7 of this Agreement prorated based on
the number of days through the end of the scheduled term of this Agreement.
The amount of such bonus, if any, will be paid to Employee pursuant to the
terms and customary operations of the Management Incentive Program (or other
applicable bonus program) except that Employee&#146;s performance will be deemed to
be at target while actual performance of Corporation will be applied; provided,
if the scheduled term of this Agreement ends after the calendar year in which
the notice of termination is given, (i)&nbsp;the bonus payment for the calendar year
in which such notice is given will be paid without any proration; (ii)&nbsp;the
amount of the bonus payment (if any) for the calendar year (the &#147;Middle Year&#148;)
immediately after the calendar year in which such notice is given and before
the calendar year in which the scheduled term of this Agreement ends, will be
paid without any proration and will be paid upon Employee&#146;s separation from
service in a lump sum between January 1 and March&nbsp;15, inclusive, of the
calendar year following the Middle Year or, if later and the payment is not
exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, upon the day after the six (6)-month anniversary of
his separation from service; and (iii)&nbsp;the amount of the bonus payment for the
calendar year in which the scheduled term of this Agreement ends will be
calculated on a pro rata basis, using the number of days elapsed during such
calendar year through the end of the scheduled term of this Agreement, and will
be paid upon Employee&#146;s separation from service in a lump sum between January 1
and March&nbsp;15, inclusive, of the calendar year following the calendar year in
which the scheduled term of this Agreement ends or, if later and the payment is
not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A, upon the day after the six (6)-month anniversary
of his separation from service;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.A(2)(d) shall be amended by:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Adding at the beginning thereof the following:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><div style="margin-left: 2%">upon Employee&#146;s separation from service,</DIV></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Adding at the end thereof a new (unnumbered)&nbsp;paragraph as follows:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><div style="margin-left: 2%">Notwithstanding the foregoing, after Employee&#146;s Actual Termination Date,
Employee shall not actively participate in any retirement plan qualified
under Code Section&nbsp;401(a), any employee stock purchase plan under Code
Section&nbsp;423, any fully insured benefit for which the insurer does not
allow post-employment participation, or any other plan or benefit (other
than Corporation&#146;s self-insured group health plan) that Corporation or
the third-party insurer of such benefit reasonably determines is not
suitable or available for post-employment participation. In such event,
Employee shall be entitled to the benefits described in clauses (i)&nbsp;and
(ii)&nbsp;of this paragraph below, to the extent applicable, up to the end of
the scheduled term of this Agreement.</DIV></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 10%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) After Employee&#146;s Actual Termination Date, Employee shall no
longer actively participate in the Aflac Incorporated 401(k) Savings and
Profit Sharing Plan (the &#147;401(k) Plan&#148;). Corporation shall pay to
Employee an
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Page 4 of 12
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">amount equal to the dollar amount of matching contributions, if any,
that would have been made to Employee&#146;s account(s) under the 401(k) Plan
if Employee had continued to actively participate in such plan for the
period from Employee&#146;s Actual Termination Date through the end of the
scheduled term of this Agreement, and had made Employee deferrals at the
deferral rate necessary to receive the maximum matching contribution (if
any) available to him under the terms of the 401(k) Plan, with such
amount being calculated as if Employee&#146;s compensation and the limits
applicable under the 401(k) plan all remained at the levels in effect as
of the date the notice of termination is given. This payment shall be
made to Employee in a lump sum upon the day of his separation from
service or, to the extent such amount is not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A,
upon the day after the six (6)-month anniversary of his separation from
service.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) If, following Employee&#146;s separation from service, Employee
does not qualify for retiree health benefits (if any) under
Corporation&#146;s group health plan, then upon Employee&#146;s separation from
service, Corporation shall allow Employee to continue to participate in
Corporation&#146;s group health plan for the remainder of the stated term of
this Agreement as if he remained an active employee; provided, Employee
pays the full premium cost for such coverage; and provided further,
Corporation shall reimburse Employee for the employer portion of the
cost of such coverage (such that Employee shall pay in net terms only
the active employee cost of such coverage) within sixty 60&nbsp;days after
the end of each calendar month in which Employee maintains such
coverage, except that such reimbursement for any continuing coverage
for his spouse and eligible dependents for the period before the six
(6)-month anniversary of his separation from service shall be paid to
him in a single lump sum upon such six (6)-month anniversary.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;Paragraphs 13.B(1)(a) and (b)&nbsp;shall be amended by deleting said paragraphs in their
entirety and replacing them with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a) pay Employee his base salary due him under Paragraph&nbsp;5 of this
Agreement up to his Actual Termination Date;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b) pay Employee an amount equal to any performance bonus compensation due
him under Paragraph&nbsp;7 of this Agreement for the period ending on the earlier of
(i)&nbsp;the termination date stated in such written notice, or (ii)&nbsp;the last day
of the calendar year in which Employee provides such written notice of
termination. The amount of said bonus, if any, will be paid to Employee
pursuant to the terms and customary operations of the Management Incentive
Program (or other applicable bonus program) except that Employee&#146;s performance
will be deemed at target while actual performance of Corporation will be
applied, and will be calculated on a pro rata basis, using the number of days
Employee was actually employed by Corporation during the calendar year in which
Employee provides such written notice of termination;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.B(1)(d) shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and
replacing it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d) pay Employee, and if elected by Employee, his spouse such retirement
benefits as are provided for in the Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (the
&#147;SERP&#148;) under Paragraph&nbsp;9 thereof. For purposes of this subparagraph, Employee
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Page 5 of 12
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">shall continue to accrue &#147;credited service&#148; as an employee under the SERP
up through the termination date stated in said notice; provided, these
provisions shall not affect the timing or form of his SERP distributions, which
shall be determined solely under the terms of the SERP.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.B(2) shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and
replacing it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2) In the event such termination by Employee shall be for &#147;good reason&#148;

Paragraph&nbsp;13 hereof.
</DIV>

replacing it with the following:
</DIV>

this Agreement up to his Actual Termination Date;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;14.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13.D shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and replacing
it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D. <U>Cooperation After Notice of Termination</U>. Following any such
notice of termination, Employee shall fully cooperate with Corporation in all
matters relating to the winding up of his pending work on behalf of Corporation
and the orderly transfer of any such pending work to other employees of
Corporation as may be designated by the Board; and to that end, Corporation
shall be entitled to full-time services of Employee through his Actual
Termination Date and such full-time or part-time services of Employee as
Corporation may reasonably require during all or any part of the sixty (60)&nbsp;day
period that both follows any such notice of termination and his Actual
Termination Date; provided, the parties acknowledge that, depending on the
level of services so required, the provision of such services may delay the
timing of Employee&#146;s separation from service.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;15.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;13 shall be amended by adding at the end thereof new paragraphs 13.E and 13.F as
follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;E. <U>Separation from Service</U>. The term &#147;separation from service&#148;
when used in this Agreement shall mean that Employee separates from service
with Corporation and all affiliates, as defined in Code Section&nbsp;409A and
guidance issued thereunder (&#147;Section&nbsp;409A&#148;). As a general overview of Section
409A&#146;s definition of &#147;separation from service&#148;, an employee separates from
service if the employee dies, retires, or otherwise has a termination of
employment with all affiliates, determined in accordance with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(1) <U>Leaves of Absence</U>. The employment relationship is treated as
continuing intact while the employee is on military leave, sick leave, or other
bona fide leave of absence if the period of such leave does not exceed six (6)
months, or, if longer, so long as the employee retains a right to reemployment
with an affiliate under an applicable statute or by contract. A leave of
absence constitutes a bona fide leave of absence only while there is a
reasonable expectation that the employee will return to
</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Page 6 of 12
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">perform services for an affiliate. If the period of leave exceeds six (6)
months and the employee does not retain a right to reemployment under an
applicable statute or by contract, the employment relationship is deemed to
terminate on the first date immediately following such six (6)-month period.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, where a leave of absence is due to any medically
determinable physical or mental impairment that can be expected to result in
death or can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than six
(6)&nbsp;months, where such impairment causes the employee to be unable to perform
the duties of his or her position of employment or any substantially similar
position of employment, a twenty-nine (29)-month period of absence shall be
substituted for such six (6)-month period.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(2) <U>Status Change</U>. Generally, if an employee performs services
both as an employee and an independent contractor, the employee must separate
from service both as an employee and as an independent contractor pursuant to
standards set forth in Treasury Regulations to be treated as having a
separation from service. However, if an employee provides services to
affiliates as an employee and as a member of the Board of Directors, the
services provided as a director are not taken into account in determining
whether the employee has a separation from service as an employee for purposes
of this Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 8%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(3) <U>Termination of Employment</U>. Whether a termination of
employment has occurred is determined based on whether the facts and
circumstances indicate that the employer and the employee reasonably anticipate
that (A)&nbsp;no further services will be performed after a certain date, or (B)&nbsp;the
level of bona fide services the employee will perform after such date (whether
as an employee or as an independent contractor) will permanently decrease to
less than 50&nbsp;percent of the average level of bona fide services performed
(whether as an employee or an independent contractor) over the immediately
preceding thirty-six (36)-month period. Facts and circumstances to be
considered in making this determination include, but are not limited to,
whether the employee continues to be treated as an employee for other purposes
(such as continuation of salary and participation in employee benefit
programs), whether similarly-situated service providers have been treated
consistently, and whether the employee is permitted, and realistically
available, to perform services for other service recipients in the same line of
business. For periods during which an employee is on a paid bona fide leave of
absence and has not otherwise terminated employment as described in
subparagraph (1)&nbsp;above, for purposes of this subparagraph, the employee is
treated as providing bona fide services at a level equal to the level of
services that the employee would have been required to perform to receive the
compensation paid with respect to such leave of absence. Periods during which
an employee is on an unpaid bona fide leave of absence and has not otherwise
terminated employment are disregarded for purposes of this subsection
(including for purposes of determining the applicable thirty-six (36)-month
period).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;F. <U>Separate Payments</U>. Each payment made to Employee pursuant to
this Paragraph&nbsp;13 or Paragraph&nbsp;18 shall be treated as a separate payment for
purposes of Code Section&nbsp;409A.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;14 shall be amended by deleting the last sentence thereof and replacing it with
the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">If upon Employee&#146;s death Employee was not eligible for (at least) an early
retirement benefit under SERP, benefits will be payable under the SERP the

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;21.&nbsp;Paragraph&nbsp;18.D shall be amended by deleting said paragraph in its entirety and replacing
it with the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;D. Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Agreement, in the event
that any payment or benefit received or to be received by Employee in
connection with a Change in Control or the termination of Employee&#146;s employment
(whether pursuant to the terms of this Agreement or any other plan, arrangement
or agreement with the Corporation, any person whose actions result in a Change
in Control or any person affiliated with the Corporation or such person) (all
such payments and benefits being hereinafter called &#147;Total Payments&#148;) would not
be deductible (in whole or in part) by the Corporation, an affiliate or person
making such payment or providing such benefit as a result of Section&nbsp;280G of
the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (the &#147;Code&#148;) then, to the extent necessary to
make such portion of the Total Payments deductible (and after taking into
account any reduction in the Total Payments provided by reason of Section&nbsp;280G
of the Code in such other plan, arrangement or agreement), adjustments in such
payments shall be made as follows: (i)&nbsp;the cash payments provided pursuant to
subparagraph B.(3) and B.(4) of this Paragraph&nbsp;18 that are exempt from Section
409A shall first be reduced (if necessary, to zero); (ii)&nbsp;then, if further
reductions are necessary, benefits provided under subparagraph B.(5) of this
Paragraph&nbsp;18 that are exempt from Section&nbsp;409A shall be reduced (if necessary,
to zero); (iii)&nbsp;then, if still further reductions are necessary, the cash
payments provided pursuant to subparagraph B.(3) and B.(4) of this Paragraph&nbsp;18
that are not exempt from Section&nbsp;409A shall be reduced (if necessary, to zero);
and (iv)&nbsp;finally, if still further reductions are necessary, all of the
benefits provided under subparagraph B.(5) of this Paragraph&nbsp;18 that are not
exempt from Section&nbsp;409A shall be forfeited. For purposes of this limitation
(i)&nbsp;no portion of the Total Payments, the receipt or enjoyment of which
Employee shall have effectively waived in writing prior to the date of
termination of employment shall be taken into account (provided that, in no
event will any such waiver impermissibly affect any portion of the Total
Payments that is subject to Section&nbsp;409A), (ii)&nbsp;no portion of the Total
Payments shall be taken into account which in the opinion of the tax counsel
selected by the Corporation&#146;s independent auditors and reasonably acceptable to
Employee does not constitute a &#147;parachute payment&#148; within the meaning of
Section&nbsp;280G(b)(2) of the Code, including by reason of Section&nbsp;280G(b)(4)(A) of
the Code, (iii)&nbsp;except as provided in clause (iv)&nbsp;above, the payments and
benefits be reduced only to the extent necessary so that the Total Payments
(other than those referred to in clauses (i)&nbsp;or (ii)) in their entirety
constitute reasonable
</DIV>

</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">compensation for services actually rendered within the meaning of Section
280G(b)(4)(B) of the Code or are otherwise not subject to disallowance as
deductions, in the opinion of the tax counsel referred to in clause (ii); and
(iv)&nbsp;the value of any non-cash benefit or any deferred payment or benefit
included in the Total Payments shall be determined by the Corporation&#146;s

and (4)&nbsp;of the Code. In no event shall the Corporation&#146;s obligation to
